title: Learnvest M.A.S.H. Calculator: How Much Will My Lifestyle Cost?

questionsList.question: What will be your primary residence?
questionsList.description: Choose or enter an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: A modest single family home in the 'burbs. ($250,000)
A condo in the city. ($300,000)
A luxury home in a gated community. ($600,000)
A house on the waterfront. ($1,200,000)

questionsList.question: Would you want to splurge on a second or vacation home?
questionsList.description: Choose or enter an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: No, one home base is enough for me. ($0)
a cabin in the mountains. ($100,000)
a condo in a beach town. ($250,000)
a condo in the city. ($300,000)
a beachfront house. ($1,200,000)

questionsList.question: What type of vehicle will/do you drive?
questionsList.description: Choose or enter an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: None. I'll ride my bike or take public transportation! ($0)
Honda Civic or similar. ($18,000)
Toyota Camry or similar. ($25,000)
Ford Expedition or similar. ($40,000)
Mercedes Benz or similar. ($60,000)

questionsList.question: How often will you trade in your wheels for a newer model?
questionsList.description: Enter an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

questionsList.question: How many kids will/do you have?
questionsList.description: Enter an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

questionsList.question: Who will care for the kids?
questionsList.description: Choose an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: My partner or I will stay at home to raise them. ($0)
My parents live nearby—free babysitting! ($0)
No kids; no childcare needed. ($0)
I'll work part-time and use daycare on those days. ($18,000 a year)
I'll keep working, so I'll get a nanny. ($30,000 a year)

questionsList.question: Will you pay for your child's college?
questionsList.description: Choose an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: No kids; no college savings needed. ($0)
Yes, for community college. ($10,000)
Yes, for state school. ($20,000)
Yes, for private school. ($160,000)

questionsList.question: How much do you like to spend on your appearance?
questionsList.description: Choose an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: I'm a minimalist. The basics work well for me, so I stick with them. ($2,000 a year)
I'm low–maintenance. I mostly wear jeans with a tee but sometimes splurge if I see a deal. ($4,000 a year)
I enjoy fashion. I search high and low, and mix moderately priced labels with thrift-store finds. ($8,000 a year)
I'm a fashionista. I love certain labels and stay on top of the latest trends. ($20,000 a year)

questionsList.question: How will you spend your free time?
questionsList.description: Choose an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: I'll get my fun for free by reading books from the library, walking and meditating. ($0 a year)
I'll keep it simple by doing most things at home—from gardening to cooking to entertaining. ($5,000 a year)
I'll pursue moderately priced hobbies such as painting and yoga, plus treat myself to nights out. ($10,000 a year)
I want to be able to eat out at fine restaurants, take up sailing and attend charity galas. ($25,000 a year)

questionsList.question: How much do you intend to travel?
questionsList.description: Choose an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: Almost never, but always in a car when I do! ($1,000 a year)
Twice a year, mostly to visit family and always domestically. ($2,000 a year)
Twice a year, possibly to Europe or Mexico but also domestically. ($5,000 a year)
Several times a year, to places like Bali, Shanghai and Cape Town. ($15,000 a year)

questionsList.question: How do you plan on spending your retirement?
questionsList.description: Choose an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: Retirement? I plan to work 'til the day I die. ($0)
I'll be working part-time for some extra income. (After part-time income, $40,000 a year)
I'll stay in my home but volunteer and occasionally travel. ($200,000 a year)
I'll live in a gated community with a golf course and travel the world. ($400,000 a year)

questionsList.question: Will you need to help pay for your parents' care?
questionsList.description: Choose an approximate amount that you would spend on this object

answers.label: Yes—for day-to-day expenses. ($30,000)
Yes—for in-home care. ($300,000)
Yes—for a nursing home or assisted living facility. ($400,000)
